repo.name: libxkbcommon
repo.description: keymap handling library for toolkits and window systems

readme.summary: Well-structured documentation with excellent clarity and build instructions, but lacks concrete code examples and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No code examples showing how to actually use the library in an application - the Quick Start section only links to external docs rather than providing inline usage examples

injection_risks.description: No user input is being directly injected into the code, but potential buffer overflow vulnerabilities exist due to large static arrays.

critical_findings: Potential buffer overflow vulnerabilities due to large static arrays
security.summary: The provided code has a moderate security risk due to potential buffer overflow vulnerabilities, but overall it appears to be well-structured and free of major security concerns.

common_complaints: Build system issues with cross-compilation and meson
Dependency handling and pkg-config generation errors
Lack of programmatic error querying mechanism for applications
Version detection complexity for multiple libxkbcommon versions
sentiment.summary: libxkbcommon shows moderate health with active bug fixes and feature requests being addressed, but users face friction around build configuration, error handling, and version management.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are highly helpful, clear, patient, and technically deep, making them an exemplary communicator in the GitHub issues and pull requests.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2026-01-01)
65 open issues with no activity for 6+ months
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no issue triage
No merged PRs in past 6 months suggesting no active development
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests missing release information
positive_signals: Recent commit exists (2026-01-01), suggesting project isn't completely dormant
maintenance.summary: libxkbcommon shows clear signs of stagnation with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite a recent commit timestamp.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally well-structured and informative, but could benefit from more concise quick start examples and better troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Docs: Lack of clear troubleshooting section or common problem solutions
Community: feature requests and missing functionality
Security: Potential buffer overflow vulnerabilities due to large static arrays
highlights: Frequent commits (160 in the past 6 months)
Active issue and PR management (32 closed issues, 77 merged PRs)
Multiple active contributors (7 in the past 6 months)
